tweet: Whether you live next to a hospital or hundreds of miles away, all Americans deserve access to quality care. In this month’s edition of #InsideMaine, @SenTinaSmith and @Cary_Medical CEO Kris Doody join me to discuss improving healthcare in rural areas. https://www.king.senate.gov/newsroom/inside-maine-podcast?fbclid=IwAR2uJxPLAYZfBr2AEYsIbeNWLHQQEpTO875dOmxOZ_-Qi6YOhRUJEfuwZgk …

By setting aggressive but realistic targets, we can mitigate the impacts of climate change and create good jobs in the process. This will create new economic opportunities, and fulfill our responsibility to preserve this world for the next generation. It’s the right thing to do.

Climate change is an urgent threat to our planet — to respond to it, we need a serious emphasis on renewable energy. I’ve introduced a bill with my colleagues to achieve 50% renewable electricity by 2035 so we can make much-needed advances in this fight. https://www.utilitydive.com/news/senators-target-50-national-renewable-energy-standard-by-2035-zero-carbon/557722/ …

Spent a great Friday with the folks at ND Paper in Rumford and MedCare Ambulance Service in Mexico, Maine! A strong reminder about those who are investing in rural Maine by creating jobs and caring for our people in the process. pic.twitter.com/dWK87xJ998

AIRING this Saturday at 10 a.m. on @WGANNews: this month’s #InsideMaine will focus on helping rural Americans access quality and affordable healthcare with Senate Rural Health Caucus chair @SenTinaSmith and @Cary_Medical CEO Kris Doody. Be sure to tune in! pic.twitter.com/iiOLKttB2a

Maine people shouldn’t be collateral damage in this escalating international dispute. That’s why I joined my colleagues in urging the administration to extend tariff relief to the lobster industry, as it did for farmers affected by tariffs. https://www.pressherald.com/2019/06/07/delegation-urges-trump-to-extend-relief-to-lobster-industry/ …

"Canada has seen its lobster exports to China nearly double. Maine may never recover its previously dominant position in this export market." 

@ChadBown shows yet again how the lobster industry is suffering due to the ongoing trade war. https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/06/chinas-two-pronged-trade-war/591877/ …

The administration’s plan doesn’t come close to setting the standards we need to address the challenges of climate change. Even worse: it makes it harder for future presidents to do the hard, necessary work of responding to these crises. We need better, and we need it now.

Climate change is an existential threat that affects us all, so we need an aggressive and unified effort to mitigate its impacts. Unfortunately, the administration’s proposal is a major setback when we need to making strides towards cleaner emissions. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/19/climate/epa-coal-emissions.html?emc=rss&partner=rss&smtyp=cur&smid=tw-nytpolitics …

Too many Americans are trapped in a vicious cycle – they don’t have access to credit, and as a result they’re denied the opportunity to build their credit for the future. This holds people back, and it’s not right – this bill would open new doors for those who are locked out.

Millions of Americans cannot access credit despite having a history of paying their bills on time – the problem is, the bills they pay aren’t included in the credit rating process. That's why I’ve cosponsored a bill to help more Americans access credit: https://financialregnews.com/measure-seeks-to-expand-credit-access/ …

On @NewDay this morning, I talked with @JohnBerman about the challenges we face with Iran. This is a complicated situation, ripe with the potential for miscalculations – we need strategic thinking and calm voices to help navigate the next steps to protect our national security. pic.twitter.com/p15YoUEUOn
TUNE IN: I’ll be joining @NewDay shortly, hope you can watch!

Acadia is far from the only national park struggling to keep up with increased visitation. I've introduced the Restore Our Parks Act with @SenRobPortman, @MarkWarner, and @SenAlexander to address the deferred maintenance backlog facing @NatlParkService. https://www.pewtrusts.org/en/research-and-analysis/articles/2019/04/09/cost-of-unaddressed-national-park-repairs-grows-to-nearly-12-billion …

Each year, 3.5 million people visit @AcadiaNPS – that’s nearly 3 times the population of Maine. Anyone who’s been to Acadia understands why it’s such a popular park – and they also know just how important it is that we protect this wonderful Maine treasure for future generations. pic.twitter.com/o7j55Y0x2O

"Mainers are practical and inventive, ready to make do with what we have and celebrate our solutions, however jury-rigged they may be. We love our neighbors and this beautiful place we call home."

You can’t make good policy without good data – and right now, we need better data on how to confront the public health threats facing the American people. I've joined @TimKaine and @SenatorIsakson on a bill that will help keep the American people healthy: https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/maine-senator-backs-push-for-better-public-health-data/2019/06/16/c36cc06e-906b-11e9-956a-88c291ab5c38_story.html?utm_term=.b7e950b6be77 …

This rule has bipartisan Congressional support, is backed by the administration, and will reduce costs for Americans who rely on these medications. If anything, the objections of these corporations makes me think we’re on the right track.

It’s commonsense: if you advertise a product to the American people, you should tell them what you’re charging. Apparently drug companies missed the memo, though — they’re suing to block a rule I have been pushing for which requires them to disclose their prices in TV ads. https://twitter.com/CNNPolitics/status/1140107505579827200 …

Acadia is both one of America’s most visited national parks and one of its smallest – so MDI needs effective transportation to manage these visitors and facilitate economic activity. These new buses are an investment that will help future generations explore a Maine treasure!

For 20 years, the Island Explorer buses have transported Mount Desert Island residents and visitors efficiently around @AcadiaNPS and the surrounding towns. On Friday, they celebrated 21 new buses added to their fleet.

A great morning celebrating #FlagDay with RSU4 students at Carrie Ricker School in Litchfield! A pleasure to mark this day with the next generation who will carry forward the ideals our flag stands for. pic.twitter.com/bNy36YoRQl

The President’s willingness to accept help from foreign adversaries contradicts the values our nation was built on, and invites others to hack, attack or influence our elections in the future. When our nation’s founders created our system of government, they were clear in their concerns about interference in our elections by foreign powers. I’ll join @MSNBC at ~1:20 to discuss the importance of heeding their warnings.

The trade war is affecting Americans of all backgrounds, but the administration is picking winners and losers, giving billions to farmers while ignoring others – like Maine’s lobster industry – who are hurting. America’s veterans carry their days of service with them – both good and bad – in mind and body every day. I hope you’ll have the opportunity to take part in the celebration of Vet Centers and all the work they’ve done to care for those who have sacrificed so much for our nation.

For four decades, Vet Centers have helped fulfill our responsibility to care for our veterans. Tomorrow is the 40th anniversary of this important program, and there are open houses happening across Maine to mark this occasion. Details in my weekly column: https://medium.com/@SenatorKing/four-decades-of-caring-for-our-veterans-3e98bcee2ee8?source=friends_link&sk=19cbf30ae43c2d9cb5515d0e0454ead6 …

It’s time to outlaw, once and for all, the “gay and trans panic” defense – because bigotry should not be an acceptable defense in the American justice system. Our LGBTQ citizens in Maine and across the nation deserve better. https://www.wabi.tv/content/news/Senator-King-endorses-bill-banning-gay-and-trans-panic-defense-511141742.html …

ONE year ago today the @FCC repealed #NetNeutrality. This was, plain and simple, a bad decision for America – one we should reverse immediately, so the internet can remain a free and open tool for all Americans. pic.twitter.com/YOdi5ttv5M

This is why I've joined my colleagues to introduce legislation that would keep the commitments we made in the Paris Agreement. We need to fix this mistake, and seriously work on an aggressive response to turn back the impacts of climate change.

The science is clear: climate change is real, and serious. America should be an international leader in responding to this challenge, but after withdrawing from the Paris Climate Agreement, we’re sitting on the sidelines instead. That is unacceptable.  https://www.king.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/king-backs-bill-urging-administration-meet-climate-standards-set-by-paris-accord …

Last month, @CMSGov finalized a rule based on my legislation requiring companies to list drug prices in TV ads. This is an important step toward real transparency: the American people deserve to know what they’re being sold. I’ll keep working to find new ways to reduce costs.

Too many Maine people are struggling to afford their medications, leaving them with an unacceptable choice of which necessity to skip. We need to reduce costs for those who rely on prescription drugs – and being transparent about prices is a good start. https://bangordailynews.com/2019/06/04/opinion/editorials/transparency-a-good-place-to-start-to-reduce-prescription-drug-costs/ …

It just doesn't make sense that this certified product has to jump through additional hoops just to be sold across state lines. Let's fix this – both to help small businesses grow and to give consumers more options of high-quality local and regional choices at the store.

When a Maine farmer produces high-quality meat that that meets or exceeds federal inspection standards, they should be able to sell it across state lines – but right now, regulations stifle that growth. @SenatorRounds and I are looking to change that. https://www.wabi.tv/content/news/Legislation-could-open-up-Maines-meat-and-poultry-industry-to-other-states-510929151.html …

Congratulations to Carrabec High School Class of 2019! Maine’s lobster industry has been hit hard by Chinese tariffs – but unlike farmers, who are also hurt by this trade war, Mainers whose livelihoods rely on lobsters have not received any relief. Henry Breton was one of four brothers from Augusta to serve in WWII, and took part in the Battle at the Bulge. It was an immense privilege to speak with these men today and thank them for their service on behalf of their state and their country. https://www.centralmaine.com/2013/05/26/world-war-ii-serviceman-prepares-to-tour-european-battlefields/ …

Charles Shay was a 19-year-old medic during the D-Day Invasion who saved many lives on Omaha Beach 75 years ago. A Penobscot Tribal Elder, Mr. Shay is the namesake of a memorial at Omaha Beach honoring the service of Native Americans during WWII. pic.twitter.com/HDhoslERzF

Today’s #DDay75thAnniversary ceremony was an incredible experience; it was humbling to be in attendance to honor the lasting contributions made by the heroes who fought on that fateful day. A pleasure to see two Maine veterans of World War II today: Charles Shay and Henry Breton. pic.twitter.com/zCWzBiYwv2

Looking out over Omaha Beach in Normandy, where we gathered today to mark #DDay75thAnniversary. An opportunity to reflect upon how we can recommit ourselves to the shared democratic values the heroes of D-Day fought to defend and to remember those who made the ultimate sacrifice. pic.twitter.com/6m6nIwkGeo

Seventy-five years ago, on this day and on this beach, more than 100,000 Allied forces landed in Normandy and turned the tide in the fight against fascism. I joined @Morning_Joe to discuss the magnitude of this day and honor the example set by those who fought on D-Day. pic.twitter.com/WlwViFrLbk

Too many Maine bridges are behind on needed maintenance. Here's the breakdown: 325 of Maine’s bridges (13.1% of bridges in the state) are less safe than we'd like. That's a serious problem; we need a thoughtful, sustainable solution, and this bill will help accomplish that goal.

Maine ranks in the top 10 of a list that no one wants to be on – percentage of bridges considered structurally deficient. I’ve cosponsored the SAFE Bridges Act to prioritize bridge repair, which will create jobs and improve safety for drivers. READ MORE: https://www.penbaypilot.com/article/sen-angus-king-cosponsors-bill-repair-325-aging-maine-bridges/119326 …

We should be considering any proposal that can conserve energy, reduce waste, and make more efficient use of our grid resources – and time-of-day pricing has the potential to do exactly that. America is better because of this amendment and all of the important work that has been done by Maine women in the century since its enactment. #19thAmendment

By finally recognizing the inherent right of women to participate in their own government, our nation came closer to fulfilling Lincoln’s vision of ‘government of the people, by the people, for the people.’ #19thAmendment

Their spirit is matched by local leaders from Kittery to Madawaska – and the door allowing these talented and dedicated public officials to serve opened 100 years ago, when America righted a wrong and took a step toward living up to our national values. #19thAmendment

From my legendary predecessors, Senators Margaret Chase Smith and @FormerSenSnowe, to current public servants like @GovJanetMills and my colleagues @SenatorCollins and @chelliepingree, women have long made invaluable contributions to Maine’s public life. #19thAmendment pic.twitter.com/N53sVjdSRp

I’ve pushed for increased rural broadband funding and worked to ensure we have accurate broadband data needed to make smart investments. As co-chair of the Senate Broadband Caucus, I’ll keep working to help rural Maine compete in the modern economy.

High-speed broadband internet is vital infrastructure in the 21st century economy, but too many communities are being left behind by slow speeds. As the @PressHerald says: it’s time to act. https://www.pressherald.com/2019/05/29/our-view-time-is-now-for-expanding-high-speed-internet-in-maine-2/ …

We can, and must, protect our environment without unfairly burdening our important fisheries. That’s why this week, I joined @SenatorCollins, @ChelliePingree, and @RepGolden to ensure that we protect right whales without threatening the livelihoods of Maine lobstermen. pic.twitter.com/HnmExY5oaf

For generations, Maine's lobster industry has operated in an environmentally conscious manner. As we work to protect right whales, it’s important to listen to the lobstermen, who support coastal communities and care deeply about our marine ecosystems. https://www.nationalfisherman.com/northeast/weighing-in-on-whales-maines-delegation-asks-for-accuracy/ …
